aboutMe.title: Martin Sotnar
paragraphs: Hello, my name is Martin and I am an IT enthusiast with a focus on frontend development.I have completed several online courses covering HTML, CSS, responsive design, Git, JavaScript, React, and other technologies. I have studied most of the courses on my own (without a lecturer). However, I have completed the JS Academy course from Skillmea (with a lecturer) as well, finished by passing the final exam.

I also have experience with the backend language Node.js and its framework Express, the SQLite database, and the Electron.js framework, which I used in one of my largest projects so far, FlavorLog (see the Projects section). In my recent projects, I also worked with TypeScript and React Routes.
I am currently focused on maintaining and expanding my existing projects and starting to work on a team game project called Color Recall.

In the future, I am planning another larger project focused on employees and their rights, benefits, and responsibilities. I would like to further develop my skills in React and TypeScript and learn to work with Tailwind on this project.
My tech. stack: HTML, CSS, GIT, JavaScript, React, TypeScript
A few experience with: Node.js, Express, SQLite, Electron

projects.title: Portfolio
projects.description: This is my very first FE project, you can find something about me here, a few of my other projects, or my contact. I am trying to use everything I've learned on this website, also trying to learn new things on it.

projects.title: Minigame
projects.description: I created this game while doing a JS Academy course. This is a simple clicking game, where the score goes up for every target hit with your mouse. When the cube drops, the game ends.

projects.title: Flavor Log
projects.description: This is my first full CRUD React project. It is my version of a personal recipe book, where you can store recipes in an SQLite database. You can use search or filters to get to them later. Every important aspect should work properly but I am still working on some UX updates/fixes and adding more features.

projects.title: Hangman
projects.description: Hangman is a letter guessing game, where you try to form a word. For each incorrect guess, a part of gallows is build. If you can guess word before gallows is completed, you win. This project was my first experience working with react routing and typing in TypeScript.
